name: 賀一平
objective:
Issues and topics discussed include: legalizing drugs, designer babies, cloning,  sexual harassment, and gun control.
The young adult novels used for common readings are: The Giver;Tuck Everlasting; The Lion, the Witch,  and the Wardrobe; A Wrinkle in Time; Ella Enchanted
schedule:
Topics and themes for study and discussion
1st week: Orientation; Oral presentation on the winter vacation reading assignment--a self-chosen young adult or children's novel
2nd week: Oral presentation on the winter vacation reading assignment--a self-chosen young adult or children's novel
3rd week: Cheating on your partner; Cyber cheating
4th week: Old enough to be her grandfather; The Giver
5th week: Big Brother is watching
6th week: Designer babies; Whose child
7th week: Cloning; Group discussion on The Giver
8th week: Oral presentation on The Giver; Submission of journal entries
9th week:  Zodiac signs
10th week: Zodiac signs; the art of palmistry
11th week: sexual harassment
12th week: Sexual harassment
Group discussion: Tuck Everlasting; The Lion, the Witch,  and the Wardrobe; A Wrinkle in Time; Ella Enchanted
13th week: Oral Presentations: Tuck Everlasting; The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe; A Wrinkle in Time; Ella Enchanted
14th week: legalizing drugs; Time to submit your journal entry
15th week: gun control
16th week: You won the lottery
17th week: TV or not TV
18th week: Oral presentations: The fourth young adult novel--a self-chosen one; Time to submit your portfolio containing all your journal entries and your final reflective paper for this course.
scorePolicy:
Evaluation
Dramatics, Oral Presentations, and Final Oral Test: 50%
Response and reflection Journal Entries:50%

MacAndrew, R., & Matinex, R. (2002). Taboos and issues. Thomson/Heine.
